conclusion: For any equilibrium state of an ideal gas, PV = n R T where n R is the (constant) product of the amount of gas and the universal gas constant.
At state A, P_A = P₁ and V_A = V₁.

premise: P_A = P₁, V_A = V₁, T_A = T₀

conclusion: At state D, P_D = P₁ and V_D = V₂.

premise: P_D = P₁, V_D = V₂, n R = (P₁ V₁) / T₀
conclusion: T_D = (P₁ V₂) / (P₁ V₁ / T₀) = T₀ (V₂ / V₁)
